title: Global green-to-teal abstract vector background replacing dual green gradients

requirements.summary: Add a new original, pronounced green-to-teal abstract vector background SVG asset for global use.
acceptanceCriteria: A new vector background asset (SVG) exists under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and visually transitions from green to teal with prominent abstract shapes.
The background is original and does not use any third-party branding, logos, or copyrighted artwork.

file_operations.description: Create the original abstract vector background SVG asset with a pronounced green-to-teal transition and prominent flowing/geometric layers (as specified in imageRequirements). Ensure no third-party branding/logos/copyrighted artwork is included.

requirements.summary: Replace the existing global dual-layer green gradient background with the new SVG background applied globally from a single shared location, without affecting routes or transitions.
acceptanceCriteria: The previous dual-gradient effect is no longer visible anywhere in the app (no remaining `::before/::after` radial gradient layers for `gradient-bg-right`).
All pages/routes show the new vector green-to-teal background consistently, without per-page modifications.
Foreground content (header, pages, footer, cards) remains readable and layered above the background (no interference with clicks/scrolling).
No existing routes, navigation behavior, or route-transition spinner/fade behavior is changed by this background update.

file_operations.description: Remove the existing `.gradient-bg-right` `::before/::after` dual radial gradient definitions (and any related custom properties if unused). Add a single global background class (e.g., `.app-vector-bg`) that applies the new SVG from `frontend/public/assets/generated/telsfx-abstract-bg.dim_1920x1080.svg` as a fixed, non-interactive background layer (pointer-events none) behind all content (safe z-index/positioning) so readability and click/scroll interactions are preserved.

Update the root layout container to stop using `gradient-bg-right` and instead use the new global background class (e.g., `app-vector-bg`) so the SVG background is applied across all routes/pages from one shared place without changing routing or route-transition behavior.
